text: Adam, Seth, Enosh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kenan, Mahalaleel, Jared,
speaker: Narrator

text: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech,
speaker: Narrator

text: Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, and Diphath, and Togarmah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Javan: Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Rodanim.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ham: Cush, and Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Cush: Seba, and Havilah, and Sabta, and Raama, and Sabtecha. And the sons of Raamah: Sheba, and Dedan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Cush begot Nimrod; he began to be mighty upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Mizraim begot Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Pathrusim, and Casluhim (from whom came the Philistines), and Caphtorim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Canaan begot Sidon his firstborn, and Heth;
speaker: Narrator

text: the Jebusite also, and the Amorite, and the Girgashite,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Hivite, and the Arkite, and the Sinite,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shem: Elam, and Asshur, and Arphaxad, and Lud, and Aram, and Uz, and Hul, and Gether, and Meshech.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Arphaxad begot Shelah, and Shelah begot Eber.
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto Eber were born two sons: the name of the one was Peleg, because in his days the earth was divided; and his brother’s name was Joktan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joktan begot Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hadoram also, and Uzal, and Diklah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ebal, and Abimael, and Sheba,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eber, Peleg, Reu,
speaker: Narrator

text: Serug, Nahor, Terah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abram, the same is Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Abraham: Isaac, and Ishmael.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are their generations: the firstborn of Ishmael, Nebaioth; then Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mishma, and Dumah, Massa, Hadad, and Tema,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: she bore Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah. And the sons of Jokshan: Sheba, and Dedan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Midian: Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abida, and Eldaah. All these are the sons of Keturah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham begot Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau and Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, and Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, and Omar, Zephi, and Gatam, Kenaz, and Timna, and Amalek.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Seir: Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah, and Dishon, and Ezer, and Dishan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Lotan: Hori, and Homam; and Timna was Lotan’s sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shobal: Alian, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. And the sons of Zibeon: Aiah, and Anah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Anah: Dishon. And the sons of Dishon: Hamran, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, and Zaavan, and Jaakan. The sons of Dishan: Uz, and Aran.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the children of Israel: Bela the son of Beor; and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Bela was dead, Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Jobab was dead, Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Husham was dead, Hadad the son of Bedad, who smote Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead; and the name of his city was Avith.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Hadad was dead, Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Samlah was dead, Shaul of Rehoboth by the River reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Shaul was dead, Baalhanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Baalhanan was dead, Hadad reigned in his stead; and the name of his city was Pai; and his wife’s name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hadad died also. And the chiefs of Edom were: Chief Timnah, Chief Aliah, Chief Jetheth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Chief Aholibamah, Chief Elah, Chief Pinon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Chief Kenaz, Chief Teman, Chief Mibzar,
speaker: Narrator

text: Chief Magdiel, Chief Iram. These are the chiefs of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Israel [or, Jacob]: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun,
speaker: Narrator

text: Dan, Joseph, and Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Judah: Er, and Onan, and Shelah, which three were born unto him by the daughter of Shua the Canaanitess. And Er, the firstborn of Judah, was evil in the sight of the Lord; and He slew him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Tamar his daughter-in-law bore him Perez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah were five.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Perez: Hezron, and Hamul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Zerah: Zimri, and Ethan, and Heman, and Calcol, and Dara, five of them in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the son of Carmi: Achar, the troubler of Israel, who transgressed in the thing accursed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the son of Ethan: Azariah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons also of Hezron who were born unto him: Jerahmeel, and Ram, and Chelubai.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ram begot Amminadab, and Amminadab begot Nahshon, prince of the children of Judah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Nahshon begot Salma, and Salma begot Boaz;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Boaz begot Obed, and Obed begot Jesse.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesse begot his firstborn Eliab, and Abinadab the second, and Shimea the third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nethanel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ozem the sixth, David the seventh,
speaker: Narrator

text: whose sisters were Zeruiah, and Abigail. And the sons of Zeruiah: Abishai, and Joab, and Asahel, three.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abigail bore Amasa; and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Caleb the son of Hezron begot children by Azubah his wife, and by Jerioth; her sons are these: Jesher, and Shobab, and Ardon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Azubah was dead, Caleb took unto him Ephrath, who bore him Hur.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hur begot Uri, and Uri begot Bezaleel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir, the father of Gilead, whom he married when he was threescore years old; and she bore him Segub.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Segub begot Jair, who had three and twenty cities in the land of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took Geshur and Aram, with the towns of Jair, from them, with Kenath and the towns thereof, even threescore cities. All these belonged to the sons of Machir, the father of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after Hezron was dead in Calebephrathah, then Abijah Hezron’s wife bore him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Jerahmeel, the firstborn of Hezron were Ram the firstborn, and Bunah, and Oren, and Ozem, and Ahijah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jerahmeel had also another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Ram, the firstborn of Jerahmeel, were Maaz, and Jamin, and Eker.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Onam were Shammai, and Jada. And the sons of Shammai: Nadab, and Abishur.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the name of the wife of Abishur was Abihail, and she bore him Ahban and Molid.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Nadab: Seled and Appaim; but Seled died without children.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the son of Appaim: Ishi. And the son of Ishi: Sheshan. And the child of Sheshan: Ahlai.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Jada the brother of Shammai: Jether and Jonathan; and Jether died without children.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Jonathan: Peleth and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Sheshan had no sons, but daughters. And Sheshan had a servant, an Egyptian whose name was Jarha.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant for a wife; and she bore him Attai.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Attai begot Nathan, and Nathan begot Zabad;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Zabad begot Ephlal, and Ephlal begot Obed;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Obed begot Jehu, and Jehu begot Azariah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Azariah begot Helez, and Helez begot Eleasah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Eleasah begot Sismai, and Sismai begot Shallum;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Shallum begot Jekamiah, and Jekamiah begot Elishama.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel were: Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph, and the sons of Mareshah the father of Hebron.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Hebron: Korah, and Tappuah, and Rekem, and Shema.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Shema begot Raham, the father of Jorkoam; and Rekem begot Shammai.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the son of Shammai was Maon; and Maon was the father of Bethzur.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ephah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Haran, and Moza, and Gazez; and Haran begot Gazez.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Jahdai: Regem, and Jotham, and Geshan, and Pelet, and Ephah, and Shaaph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Maachah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Sheber and Tirhanah.
speaker: Narrator

text: She bore also Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbenah and the father of Gibea; and the daughter of Caleb was Achsah.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Caleb the son of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah: Shobal the father of Kirjathjearim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Salma the father of Bethlehem, Hareph the father of Bethgader.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Shobal the father of Kirjathjearim had sons: Haroeh, and half of the Manahethites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the families of Kirjathjearim: the Ithrites, and the Puthites, and the Shumathites, and the Mishraites; from them came the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Salma: Bethlehem, and the Netophathites, Ataroth, the house of Joab, and half of the Manahethites, the Zorites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the families of the scribes who dwelt at Jabez: the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, and Suchathites. These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these were the sons of David who were born unto him in Hebron: the firstborn, Amnon, by Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; the second, Daniel, by Abigail the Carmelitess;
speaker: Narrator

text: the third, Absalom, the son of Maacah the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur; the fourth, Adonijah, the son of Haggith;
speaker: Narrator

text: the fifth, Shephatiah by Abital; the sixth, Ithream by Eglah his wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: These six were born unto him in Hebron; and there he reigned seven years and six months, and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty and three years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these were born unto him in Jerusalem: Shimea, and Shobab, and Nathan, and Solomon, four by Bathshua the daughter of Ammiel;
speaker: Narrator

text: Ibhar also, and Elishama, and Eliphelet,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Elishama, and Eliada, and Eliphelet, nine.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were all the sons of David, besides the sons of the concubines, and Tamar their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon’s son was Rehoboam; Abijah was his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Amon his son, Josiah his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Josiah were the firstborn Johanan, the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, the fourth Shallum.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Jehoiakim: Jeconiah his son, Zedekiah his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Jeconiah: Assir, Shealtiel his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Malchiram also, and Pedaiah, and Shenazzar, Jecamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Pedaiah were Zerubbabel and Shimei; and the sons of Zerubbabel: Meshullam, and Hananiah, and Shelomith their sister;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Hashubah, and Ohel, and Berechiah, and Hasadiah, Jushabhesed, five.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Hananiah: Pelatiah, and Jeshaiah; the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, the sons of Shechaniah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the son of Shechaniah, Shemaiah; and the sons of Shemaiah: Hattush, and Igal, and Bariah, and Neariah, and Shaphat, six.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Neariah: Elioenai, and Hezekiah, and Azrikam, three.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Elioenai were Hodaviah, and Eliashib, and Pelaiah, and Akkub, and Johanan, and Delaiah, and Anani, seven.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Judah: Perez, Hezron, and Carmi, and Hur, and Shobal.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Reaiah the son of Shobal begot Jahath, and Jahath begot Ahumai and Lahad. These are the families of the Zorathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these were by the father of Etam: Jezreel, and Ishma, and Idbash; and the name of their sister was Hazelelponi;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Penuel the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah. These are the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, the father of Bethlehem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, and Hepher, and Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Helah were Zereth, and Jezoar, and Ethnan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Koz begot Anub, and Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel the son of Harum.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jabez was more honorable than his brethren; and his mother called his name Jabez [that is, Sorrowful], saying, “Because I bore him with sorrow.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, “Oh that Thou wouldest bless me indeed and enlarge my borders, and that Thine hand might be with me and that Thou wouldest keep me from evil, that it may not grieve me!” And God granted him that which he requested.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Chelub the brother of Shuhah begot Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Eshton begot Bethrapha, and Paseah, and Tehinnah the father of Irnahash. These are the men of Recah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Kenaz: Othniel and Seraiah; and the sons of Othniel: Hathath
speaker: Narrator

text: and Meonothai, who begot Ophrah; and Seraiah begot Joab, the father of the inhabitants of the valley of Charashim [that is, Craftsmen], for they were craftsmen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Caleb the son of Jephunneh: Iru, Elah, and Naam; and the son of Elah, even Kenaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Jehaleleel: Ziph, and Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Ezrah were Jether, and Mered, and Epher, and Jalon. And she bore Miriam, and Shammai, and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his wife Jehudijah [or, the Jewess] bore Jered the father of Gedor, and Heber the father of Socho, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah. And these are the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered took,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the sons of his wife Hodiah [or Jehudiiah, mentioned before] the sister of Naham, the father of Keilah the Garmite, and Eshtemoa the Maachathite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Shimon were Amnon, and Rinnah, Benhanan, and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi were Zoheth, and Benzoheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shelah the son of Judah were Er the father of Lecah, and Laadah the father of Mareshah, and the families of the house of those who wrought fine linen of the house of Ashbea;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jokim, and the men of Chozeba, and Joash, and Saraph, who had the dominion in Moab, and Jashubilehem. And these are ancient things.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the potters and those who dwelt among plants and hedges; there they dwelt with the king for his work.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Simeon were Nemuel, and Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, and Shaul;
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum was his son, Mibsam his son, Mishma his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Mishma: Hamuel his son, Zacchur his son, Shimei his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters; but his brethren had not many children, neither did all their family multiply like the children of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they dwelt at Beersheba, and Moladah, and Hazarshual,
speaker: Narrator

text: and at Bilhah, and at Ezem, and at Tolad,
speaker: Narrator

text: and at Bethuel, and at Hormah, and at Ziklag,
speaker: Narrator

text: and at Bethmarcaboth, and Hazarsusim, and at Bethbirei, and at Shaaraim. These were their cities until the reign of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their villages were Etam, and Ain, Rimmon, and Tochen, and Ashan, five cities,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all their villages that were round about the same cities as far as Baal. These were their habitations and their genealogy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Meshobab, and Jamlech, and Joshah the son of Amaziah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Joel, and Jehu the son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Elioenai, and Jaakobah, and Jeshohaiah, and Asaiah, and Adiel, and Jesimiel, and Benaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah —
speaker: Narrator

text: these mentioned by their names were princes in their families; and the house of their fathers increased greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went to the entrance of Gedor, even unto the east side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they found lush pasture and good, and the land was wide and quiet and peaceable; for they of Ham had dwelt there of old.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these written by name came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah; and smote their tents and the inhabitants who were found there, and destroyed them utterly unto this day, and dwelt in their place, because there was pasture there for their flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some of them, even of the sons of Simeon, five hundred men, went to Mount Seir, having for their captains Pelatiah, and Neariah, and Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they smote the rest of the Amalekites who had escaped, and dwelt there unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel (for he was the firstborn; but forasmuch as he defiled his father’s bed, his birthright was given unto the sons of Joseph the son of Israel, and the genealogy is not to be reckoned after the birthright.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Judah prevailed above his brethren, and from him came the chief ruler, but the birthright was Joseph’s) —
speaker: Narrator

text: the sons, I say, of Reuben the firstborn of Israel were Hanoch, and Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Joel: Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beerah his son, whom Tilgathpilneser king of Assyria carried away captive; he was prince of the Reubenites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his brethren by their families, when the genealogy of their generations was reckoned, were the chief Jeiel, and Zechariah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Bela the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel,who dwelt in Aroer, even unto Nebo and Baalmeon;
speaker: Narrator

text: and eastward he inhabited unto the entrance of the wilderness from the River Euphrates, because their cattle had multiplied in the land of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the days of Saul they made war with the Hagrites, who fell by their hand; and they dwelt in their tents throughout all the east land of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Gad dwelt opposite them in the land of Bashan to Salcah:
speaker: Narrator

text: Joel the chief, and Shapham the next, and Jaanai, and Shaphat in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their brethren of the house of their fathers were Michael, and Meshullam, and Sheba, and Jorai, and Jachan, and Zia, and Heber, seven.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the children of Abihail the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz;
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahi the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, chief of the house of their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they dwelt in Gilead in Bashan, and in her towns, and in all the suburbs of Sharon upon their borders.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were reckoned by genealogies in the days of Jotham king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Reuben and the Gadites and half the tribe of Manasseh, valiant men, men able to bear buckler and sword, and to shoot with bow and skillful in war, were four and forty thousand seven hundred and threescore who went out to the war.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made war with the Hagrites, with Jetur, and Naphish, and Nodab.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were helped against them, and the Hagrites were delivered into their hand, and all who were with them; for they cried to God in the battle, and He was entreated by them, because they put their trust in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took away their cattle, of their camels fifty thousand, and of sheep two hundred and fifty thousand, and of asses two thousand, and of men a hundred thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there fell down many slain, because the war was of God. And they dwelt in their lands until the captivity.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of the halftribe of Manasseh dwelt in the land; they increased from Bashan to Baalhermon and Senir, and to Mount Hermon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these were the heads of the house of their fathers: even Epher, and Ishi, and Eliel, and Azriel, and Jeremiah, and Hodaviah, and Jahdiel, mighty men of valor, famous men, and heads of the house of their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they transgressed against the God of their fathers, and went a whoring after the gods of the people of the land, whom God destroyed before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria, and the spirit of Tilgathpilneser king of Assyria, and he carried them away, even the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the halftribe of Manasseh, and brought them unto Halah, and Habor, and Hara, and to the River Gozan unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Amram: Aaron, and Moses, and Miriam. The sons also of Aaron: Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar begot Phinehas, begot Abishua,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Abishua begot Bukki, and Bukki begot Uzzi,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Uzzi begot Zerahiah, and Zerahiah begot Meraioth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Meraioth begot Amariah, and Amariah begot Ahitub,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ahitub begot Zadok, and Zadok begot Ahimaaz,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ahimaaz begot Azariah, and Azariah begot Johanan,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Johanan begot Azariah (he it was who executed the priest’s office in the temple that Solomon built in Jerusalem),
speaker: Narrator

text: and Azariah begot Amariah, and Amariah begot Ahitub,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ahitub begot Zadok, and Zadok begot Shallum,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Shallum begot Hilkiah, and Hilkiah begot Azariah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Azariah begot Seraiah, and Seraiah begot Jehozadak;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jehozadak went into captivity when the Lord carried away Judah and Jerusalem by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Levi: Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the names of the sons of Gershom: Libni and Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Kohath were Amram, and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. And these are the families of the Levites according to their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Gershom: Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, Jeatherai his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath: Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elkanah his son, and Ebiasaph his son, and Assir his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son, and Shaul his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Elkanah: Amasai and Ahimoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for Elkanah, the sons of Elkanah: Zophai his son, and Nahath his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, Elkanah his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Samuel: the firstborn called Joel, and Abijah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari: Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shimea his son, Haggiah his son, Asaiah his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are they whom David set over the service of song in the house of the Lord after the ark came to rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they ministered before the dwelling place of the tabernacle of the congregation with singing, until Solomon had built the house of the Lord in Jerusalem; and then they served in their office according to their order.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are those who served with their children. Of the sons of the Kohathites: Heman a singer, the son of Joel, the son of Samuel,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his brother Asaph, who stood at his right hand, even Asaph the son of Berachiah, the son of Shimea,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malchijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Jahath, the son of Gershom, the son of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their brethren the sons of Merari stood at the left hand: Ethan the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluch,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shamer,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their brethren also, the Levites, were appointed unto all manner of service of the tabernacle of the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Aaron and his sons offered upon the altar of the burnt offering and on the altar of incense, and were appointed for all the work of the place most holy, and to make an atonement for Israel, according to all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the sons of Aaron: Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zadok his son, Ahimaaz his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are their dwelling places throughout their camps in their borders, of the sons of Aaron, of the families of the Kohathites, for theirs was the lot:
speaker: Narrator

text: and they gave them Hebron in the land of Judah, and the suburbs thereof round about it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the fields of the city and the villages thereof, they gave to Caleb the son of Jephunneh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to the sons of Aaron they gave the cities of Judah, namely: Hebron, the city of refuge, and Libnah with her suburbs, and Jattir and Eshtemoa with their suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Hilen with her suburbs, Debir with her suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ashan with her suburbs, and Bethshemesh with her suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And out of the tribe of Benjamin: Geba with her suburbs, and Alemeth with her suburbs, and Anathoth with her suburbs. All their cities throughout their families were thirteen cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto the sons of Kohath who were left of the family of that tribe, were cities given out of the halftribe, namely, out of the halftribe of Manasseh, by lot, ten cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to the sons of Gershom, throughout their families out of the tribe of Issachar, and out of the tribe of Asher, and out of the tribe of Naphtali, and out of the tribe of Manasseh in Bashan, thirteen cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto the sons of Merari were given by lot, throughout their families, out of the tribe of Reuben, and out of the tribe of Gad, and out of the tribe of Zebulun, twelve cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel gave to the Levites these cities with their suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they gave by lot out of the tribe of the children of Judah, and out of the tribe of the children of Simeon, and out of the tribe of the children of Benjamin these cities, which are called by their names.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the residue of the families of the sons of Kohath had cities of their borders out of the tribe of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they gave unto them, of the cities of refuge, Shechem on Mount Ephraim with her suburbs; they gave also Gezer with her suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jokmeam with her suburbs, and Bethhoron with her suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Aijalon with her suburbs, and Gathrimmon with her suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And out of the halftribe of Manasseh: Aner with her suburbs, and Bileam with her suburbs, for the family of the remnant of the sons of Kohath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto the sons of Gershom were given out of the family of the halftribe of Manasseh: Golan in Bashan with her suburbs, and Ashtaroth with her suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And out of the tribe of Issachar: Kedesh with her suburbs, Daberath with her suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ramoth with her suburbs, and Anem with her suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And out of the tribe of Asher: Mashal with her suburbs, and Abdon with her suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Hukok with her suburbs, and Rehob with her suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And out of the tribe of Naphtali: Kedesh in Galilee with her suburbs, and Hammon with her suburbs, and Kirjathaim with her suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto the rest of the children of Merari were given out of the tribe of Zebulun, Rimmon with her suburbs, Tabor with her suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the other side of the Jordan by Jericho, on the east side of the Jordan, were given them, out of the tribe of Reuben: Bezer in the wilderness with her suburbs, and Jahzah with her suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kedemoth also with her suburbs, and Mephaath with her suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And out of the tribe of Gad: Ramoth in Gilead with her suburbs, and Mahanaim with her suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Heshbon with her suburbs, and Jazer with her suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Issachar were Tola, and Puah, Jashub, and Shimron, four.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Tola: Uzzi, and Rephaiah, and Jeriel, and Jahmai, and Jibsam, and Shemuel, heads of their father’s house, to wit, of Tola. They were valiant men of might in their generations, whose number was in the days of David two and twenty thousand and six hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the son of Uzzi: Izrahiah. And the sons of Izrahiah: Michael, and Obadiah, and Joel, Ishiah, five, all of them chief men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And with them, by their generations, according to the house of their fathers, were bands of soldiers for war, six and thirty thousand men; for they had many wives and sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their brethren among all the families of Issachar were valiant men of might, reckoned in all by their genealogies, fourscore and seven thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Benjamin: Bela, and Becher, and Jediael, three.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Bela: Ezbon, and Uzzi, and Uzziel, and Jerimoth, and Iri, five, heads of the house of their fathers, mighty men of valor, and were reckoned by their genealogies twenty and two thousand and thirty and four.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Becher: Zemirah, and Joash, and Eliezer, and Elioenai, and Omri, and Jerimoth, and Abijah, and Anathoth, and Alemeth. All these are the sons of Becher.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the number of them according to their genealogy by their generations, heads of the house of their fathers, mighty men of valor, was twenty thousand and two hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son also of Jediael: Bilhan. And the sons of Bilhan: Jeush, and Benjamin, and Ehud, and Chenaanah, and Zethan, and Tharshish, and Ahishahar.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these, the sons of Jediael, by the heads of their fathers, mighty men of valor, were seventeen thousand and two hundred soldiers, fit to go out for war and battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shuppim also, and Huppim, the children of Ir, and Hushim the son of Aher.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Naphtali: Jahziel, and Guni, and Jezer, and Shallum, the sons of Bilhah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Manasseh: Asriel, whom she bore (but his concubine the Aramitess bore Machir the father of Gilead;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Machir took for a wife the sister of Huppim and Shuppim, whose sister’s name was Maachah); and the name of the second was Zelophehad, and Zelophehad had daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Maachah the wife of Machir bore a son, and she called his name Peresh; and the name of his brother was Sheresh; and his sons were Ulam and Rakem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the son of Ulam: Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his sister Hammoleketh bore Ishhod, and Abiezer, and Mahlah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Shemida were Ahian, and Shechem, and Likhi, and Aniam.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Ephraim: Shuthelah, and Bered his son, and Tahath his son, and Eladah his son, and Tahath his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Zabad his son, and Shuthelah his son, and Ezer, and Elead, whom the men of Gath who were born in that land slew, because they came down to take away their cattle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ephraim their father mourned many days, and his brethren came to comfort him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he went in to his wife, she conceived and bore a son; and he called his name Beriah, because it went evil with his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: (And his daughter was Sheerah, who built Bethhoron the nether and the upper, and Uzzensherah).
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rephah was his son, also Resheph, and Telah his son, and Tahan his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Laadan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nun his son, Joshua his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their possessions and habitations were Bethel and the towns thereof, and eastward Naaran, and westward Gezer with the towns thereof, Shechem also and the towns thereof, unto Ayyah and the towns thereof;
speaker: Narrator

text: and by the borders of the children of Manasseh, Bethshean and her towns, Taanach and her towns, Megiddo and her towns, Dor and her towns. In these dwelt the children of Joseph the son of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Asher: Imnah, and Isvah, and Ishvi, and Beriah, and Serah their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Beriah: Heber, and Malchiel, who is the father of Birzaith.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Heber begot Japhlet, and Shomer, and Hotham, and Shua their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Japhlet: Pasach, and Bimhal, and Ashvath. These are the children of Japhlet.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Shemer: Ahi, and Rohgah, Jehubbah, and Aram.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of his brother Helem: Zophah, and Imna, and Shelesh, and Amal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Zophah: Suah, and Harnepher, and Shual, and Beri, and Imrah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezer, and Hod, and Shamma, and Shilshah, and Ithran, and Beera.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Jether: Jephunneh, and Pispah, and Ara.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Ulla: Arah, and Haniel, and Rizia.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were the children of Asher, heads of their fathers’ houses, choice and mighty men of valor, chief of the princes. And the number throughout the genealogy of those who were apt in war and in battle was twenty and six thousand men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Benjamin begot Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second, and Aharah the third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Bela were Addar, and Gera, and Abihud,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Abishua, and Naaman, and Ahoah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Gera, and Shephuphan, and Huram.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the sons of Ehud (these are the heads of the fathers of the inhabitants of Geba, and they removed them to Manahath):
speaker: Narrator

text: Naaman, and Ahijah, and Gera who removed them and begot Uzza and Ahihud.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Shaharaim begot children in the country of Moab after he had sent them away; Hushim and Baara were his wives.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he begot by Hodesh his wife, Jobab, and Zibia, and Mesha, and Malcham,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jeuz, and Sachia, and Mirmah. These were his sons, heads of the fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And by Hushim he begot Abitub, and Elpaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Elpaal: Eber, and Misham, and Shemed, who built Ono and Lod with the towns thereof;
speaker: Narrator

text: Beriah also, and Shema, who were heads of the fathers of the inhabitants of Aijalon, who drove away the inhabitants of Gath.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ahio, Shashak, and Jeremoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Zebadiah, and Arad, and Eder,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Michael, and Ispah, and Joha were the sons of Beriah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Zebadiah, and Meshullam, and Hizki, and Heber,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ishmerai also, and Jezliah, and Jobab the sons of Elpaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jakim, and Zichri, and Zabdi,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Elienai, and Zillethai, and Eliel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Adaiah, and Beraiah, and Shimrath, the sons of Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ishpan, and Eber, and Eliel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Abdon, and Zichri, and Hanan,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Hananiah, and Elam, and Antothijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Iphdeiah, and Penuel were the sons of Shashak.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Shamsherai, and Shehariah, and Athaliah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jaareshiah, and Elijah, and Zichri were the sons of Jeroham.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were heads of the fathers by their generations, chief men. These dwelt in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at Gibeon dwelt the father of Gibeon, whose wife’s name was Maacah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his firstborn son was Abdon, then Zur, and Kish, and Baal, and Nadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Gedor, and Ahio, and Zecher.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Mikloth begot Shimeah. And these also dwelt with their brethren in Jerusalem, opposite them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ner begot Kish, and Kish begot Saul, and Saul begot Jonathan, and Malchishua, and Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the son of Jonathan was Meribbaal; and Meribbaal begot Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Micah were Pithon, and Melech, and Tarea, and Ahaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ahaz begot Jehoaddah; and Jehoaddah begot Alemeth, and Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri begot Moza.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moza begot Binea; Raphah was his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Azel had six sons whose names are these: Azrikam, Bocheru, and Ishmael, and Sheariah, and Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Eshek his brother were Ulam his firstborn, Jeush the second, and Eliphelet the third.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Ulam were mighty men of valor, archers, and had many sons and sons’ sons, a hundred and fifty. All these were of the sons of Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all Israel were reckoned by genealogies; and behold, they were written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah, who were carried away to Babylon for their transgression.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the first inhabitants who dwelt in their possessions in their cities were the Israelites, the priests, Levites, and the Nethinim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in Jerusalem dwelt of the children of Judah, and of the children of Benjamin, and of the children of Ephraim and Manasseh:
speaker: Narrator

text: Uthai the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, of the children of Perez the son of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the Shilonites: Asaiah the firstborn, and his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the sons of Zerah: Jeuel, and their brethren, six hundred and ninety.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the sons of Benjamin: Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ibneiah the son of Jeroham, and Elah the son of Uzzi, the son of Michri, and Meshullam the son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and their brethren according to their generations, nine hundred and fifty and six. All these men were chief of the fathers in the house of their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the priests: Jedaiah, and Jehoiarib, and Jachin,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Azariah the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the ruler of the house of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Adaiah the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashur, the son of Malchijah, and Maasai the son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer,
speaker: Narrator

text: and their brethren, heads of the house of their fathers, a thousand and seven hundred and threescore, very able men for the work of the service of the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the Levites: Shemaiah the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, of the sons of Merari,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Bakbakkar, Heresh, and Galal, and Mattaniah the son of Micah, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Obadiah the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun, and Berechiah the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, who dwelt in the villages of the Netophathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the doorkeepers were Shallum, and Akkub, and Talmon, and Ahiman, and their brethren; Shallum was the chief,
speaker: Narrator

text: who hitherto waited in the King’s Gate eastward; they were doorkeepers in the companies of the children of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Shallum the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his brethren, of the house of his father, the Korahites, were over the work of the service, keepers of the gates of the tabernacle; and their fathers, being over the host of the Lord, were keepers of the entrance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Phinehas the son of Eleazar was the ruler over them in time past, and the Lord was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Zechariah the son of Meshelemiah was doorkeeper of the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these who were chosen to be doorkeepers at the gates were two hundred and twelve. These were reckoned by their genealogy in their villages, whom David and Samuel the seer had ordained in their set office.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they and their children had the oversight of the gates of the house of the Lord, namely, the house of the tabernacle, by watches.
speaker: Narrator

text: In four quarters were the doorkeepers: toward the east, west, north, and south.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their brethren, who were in their villages, had to come after seven days from time to time with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For these Levites, the four chief doorkeepers, were in their trust, and were over the chambers and treasuries of the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they lodged round about the house of God, because the charge was upon them, and the opening thereof every morning pertained to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And certain of them had charge of the ministering vessels, that they should bring them in and out by tally.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of them also were appointed to oversee the vessels and all the instruments of the sanctuary, and the fine flour, and the wine, and the oil, and the frankincense, and the spices.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some of the sons of the priests made the ointment of the spices.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Mattithiah, one of the Levites, who was the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, had the trust over the things that were made in the pans.
speaker: Narrator

text: And other of their brethren, of the sons of the Kohathites, were over the showbread to prepare it every Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the singers, chief of the fathers of the Levites, who remaining in the chambers were free; for they were employed in that work day and night.
speaker: Narrator

text: These chief fathers of the Levites were chief throughout their generations; these dwelt at Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in Gibeon dwelt the father of Gibeon, Jeiel, whose wife’s name was Maacah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his firstborn son was Abdon, then Zur, and Kish, and Baal, and Ner, and Nadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Gedor, and Ahio, and Zechariah, and Mikloth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Mikloth begot Shimeam. And they also dwelt with their brethren at Jerusalem, opposite their brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ner begot Kish; and Kish begot Saul; and Saul begot Jonathan, and Malchishua, and Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the son of Jonathan was Meribbaal; and Meribbaal begot Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Micah were Pithon, and Melech, and Tahrea, and Ahaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ahaz begot Jarah; and Jarah begot Alemeth, and Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri begot Moza;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Moza begot Binea; and Rephaiah his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Azel had six sons whose names are these: Azrikam, Bocheru, and Ishmael, and Sheariah, and Obadiah, and Hanan; these were the sons of Azel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Philistines fought against Israel; and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell down slain on Mount Gilboa.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Philistines followed hard after Saul and after his sons; and the Philistines slew Jonathan and Abinadab and Malchishua, the sons of Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the battle went sorely against Saul; and the archers hit him, and he was wounded by the archers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Saul to his armorbearer, “Draw thy sword, and thrust me through therewith, lest these uncircumcised come and abuse me.” But his armorbearer would not, for he was sore afraid. So Saul took a sword and fell upon it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when his armorbearer saw that Saul was dead, he fell likewise on the sword and died.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Saul died, and his three sons, and all his house died together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when all the men of Israel who were in the valley saw that they fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead, then they forsook their cities and fled; and the Philistines came and dwelt in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass on the morrow, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, that they found Saul and his sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had stripped him, they took his head and his armor, and sent into the land of the Philistines round about to carry tidings unto their idols and to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they put his armor in the house of their gods, and fastened his head in the temple of Dagon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when all Jabeshgilead heard all that the Philistines had done to Saul,
speaker: Narrator

text: they arose, all the valiant men, and took away the body of Saul and the bodies of his sons and brought them to Jabesh, and buried their bones under the oak in Jabesh, and fasted seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Saul died for his transgression which he committed against the Lord, even against the word of the Lord which he kept not, and also for asking counsel of one who had a familiar spirit, to inquire of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he inquired not of the Lord. Therefore He slew him, and turned the kingdom over to David the son of Jesse.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all Israel gathered themselves to David at Hebron, saying, “Behold, we are thy bone and thy flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And moreover in times past, even when Saul was king, thou wast he that leddest out and broughtest in Israel; and the Lord thy God said unto thee, ‘Thou shalt feed My people Israel, and thou shalt be ruler over My people Israel.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore came all the elders of Israel to the king at Hebron, and David made a covenant with them in Hebron before the Lord. And they anointed David king over Israel, according to the word of the Lord by the hand of Samuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David and all Israel went to Jerusalem, which is Jebus, where the Jebusites were, the inhabitants of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the inhabitants of Jebus said to David, “Thou shalt not come hither.” Nevertheless David took the citadel of Zion, which is the City of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said, “Whosoever smiteth the Jebusites first shall be chief and captain.” So Joab the son of Zeruiah went first up, and was chief.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David dwelt in the citadel; therefore they called it the City of David [that is, Zion].
speaker: Narrator

text: And he built the city round about, even from Millo round about; and Joab repaired the rest of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David waxed greater and greater; for the Lord of hosts was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: These also are the chief of the mighty men whom David had, who held strongly with him in his kingdom, and with all Israel, to make him king according to the word of the Lord concerning Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the number of the mighty men whom David had: Jashobeam, a Hachmonite, the chief of the captains; he lifted up his spear against three hundred, slain by him at one time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite, who was one of the three mighty men.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was with David at Pasdammim. And there the Philistines were gathered together for battle, where there was a parcel of ground full of barley. And the people fled from before the Philistines.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they set themselves in the midst of that parcel, and delivered it, and slew the Philistines; and the Lord saved them by a great deliverance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now three of the thirty captains went down to the rock to David, into the cave of Adullam; and the host of the Philistines encamped in the Valley of Rephaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David was then in his hideout, and the Philistines’ garrison was then at Bethlehem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David longed and said, “Oh that one would give me a drink of the water of the well of Bethlehem that is at the gate!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the three broke through the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Bethlehem that was by the gate, and took it and brought it to David. But David would not drink of it, but poured it out to the Lord
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “My God forbid me that I should do this thing! Shall I drink the blood of these men, who have put their lives in jeopardy? For with the jeopardy of their lives they brought it.” Therefore he would not drink it. These things did these three mightiest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abishai the brother of Joab, he was chief of the three: for lifting up his spear against three hundred, he slew them, and had a name among the three.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the three, he was more honorable than the two, for he was their captain; however he attained not to the first three.
speaker: Narrator

text: Benaiah was the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done many acts: he slew two lionlike men of Moab; also he went down and slew a lion in a pit on a snowy day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he slew an Egyptian, a man of great stature, five cubits high. And in the Egyptian’s hand was a spear like a weaver’s beam; and he went down to him with a staff and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand, and slew him with his own spear.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and had a name among the three mighties.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, he was honorable among the thirty, but attained not to the first three; and David set him over his guard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the valiant men of the armies were Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Anathothite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Maharai the Netophathite, Heled the son of Baanah the Netophathite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ithai the son of Ribai of Gibeah, who pertained to the children of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hurai of the brooks of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: the sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan the son of Shage the Hararite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahiam the son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal the son of Ur,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai the son of Ezbai,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar the son of Hagri,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite, the armorbearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Uriah the Hittite, Zabad the son of Ahlai,
speaker: Narrator

text: Adina the son of Shiza the Reubenite, a captain of the Reubenites, and thirty with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hanan the son of Maachah, and Joshaphat the Mithnite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel the sons of Hotham the Aroerite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jediael the son of Shimri, and Joha his brother, the Tizite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliel the Mahavite, and Jeribai, and Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam, and Ithmah the Moabite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliel, and Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are they that came to David at Ziklag, while he yet kept himself hidden because of Saul the son of Kish; and they were among the mighty men, helpers of the war.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were armed with bows, and could use both the right hand and the left in hurling stones and shooting arrows out of a bow, even of Saul’s brethren of Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief was Ahiezer, then Joash, the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; and Jeziel and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth; and Berachah, and Jehu the Anathothite,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty man among the thirty, and over the thirty; and Jeremiah, and Jahaziel, and Johanan, and Jozabad the Gederathite;
speaker: Narrator

text: Eluzai, and Jerimoth, and Bealiah, and Shemariah, and Shephatiah the Haruphite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elkanah, and Jesiah, and Azareel, and Joezer, and Jashobeam, the Korahites;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Joelah and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham of Gedor.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the Gadites there separated themselves unto David into his hideout in the wilderness men of might and men of war fit for the battle, who could handle shield and buckler, whose faces were like the faces of lions, and were as swift as the roes upon the mountains:
speaker: Narrator

text: Ezer the first, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeremiah the tenth, Machbanai the eleventh.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were of the sons of Gad, captains of the host; one of the least was over a hundred, and the greatest over a thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the ones who went over the Jordan in the first month, when it had overflown all his banks; and they put to flight all those of the valleys, both toward the east and toward the west.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there came some of the children of Benjamin and Judah to the hideout unto David.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David went out to meet them, and answered and said unto them, “If ye have come peaceably unto me to help me, mine heart shall be knit unto you; but if ye have come to betray me to mine enemies, seeing there is no wrong in mine hands, the God of our fathers look thereon and rebuke it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Spirit came upon Amasai, who was chief of the captains, and he said, “Thine are we, David, and on thy side, thou son of Jesse. Peace, peace be unto thee, and peace be to thine helpers; for thy God helpeth thee.” Then David received them, and made them captains of the band.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there fell away some of Manasseh to David when he came with the Philistines against Saul to battle; but they helped them not, for the lords of the Philistines, upon advisement, sent him away, saying, “He will return to his master Saul to the jeopardy of our heads.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As he went to Ziklag there fell to him of Manasseh: Adnah, and Jozabad, and Jediael, and Michael, and Jozabad, and Elihu, and Zillethai, captains of the thousands who were from Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they helped David against the band of the rovers; for they were all mighty men of valor, and were captains in the host.
speaker: Narrator

text: For at that time day by day they came to David to help him, until it was a great host, like the host of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the numbers of the armed groups ready for war, and came to David at Hebron to turn the kingdom of Saul to him, according to the word of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Judah who bore shield and spear were six thousand and eight hundred, ready, armed for the war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the children of Simeon, mighty men of valor for the war, seven thousand and one hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the children of Levi four thousand and six hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehoiada was the leader of the Aaronites, and with him were three thousand and seven hundred;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Zadok, a young man mighty of valor, and from his father’s house twenty and two captains.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the children of Benjamin, the kindred of Saul, three thousand; for hitherto the greatest part of them had kept the watch of the house of Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the children of Ephraim twenty thousand and eight hundred, mighty men of valor, famous throughout the house of their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the halftribe of Manasseh eighteen thousand, who were expressed by name to come and make David king.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the children of Issachar, who were men that had understanding of the times, to know what Israel ought to do, the heads of them were two hundred; and all their brethren were at their command.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Zebulun, such as went forth to battle, expert in war with all instruments of war, fifty thousand who could keep rank; they were not of double heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of Naphtali a thousand captains, and with them with shield and spear, thirty and seven thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the Danites, expert in war, twenty and eight thousand and six hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of Asher, such as went forth to battle, expert in war, forty thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the other side of the Jordan, of the Reubenites and the Gadites, and of the halftribe of Manasseh, with all manner of instruments of war for the battle, a hundred and twenty thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these men of war, who could keep rank, came with a perfect heart to Hebron to make David king over all Israel; and all the rest also of Israel were of one heart to make David king.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there they were with David three days, eating and drinking, for their brethren had prepared for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover those who were nigh to them, even as far as Issachar and Zebulun and Naphtali, brought bread on asses, and on camels, and on mules, and on oxen, and meat, meal, cakes of figs, and bunches of raisins, and wine, and oil, and oxen, and sheep abundantly; for there was joy in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David consulted with the captains of thousands and hundreds, and with every leader.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said unto all the congregation of Israel, “If it seem good unto you, and if it be of the Lord our God, let us send abroad unto our brethren everywhere who are left in all the land of Israel, and with them also to the priests and Levites who are in their cities and suburbs, that they may gather themselves unto us.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let us bring back the ark of our God to us, for we inquired not at it in the days of Saul.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the congregation said that they would do so, for the thing was right in the eyes of all the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David gathered all Israel together from Shihor of Egypt, even unto the entrance of Hemath, to bring the ark of God from Kirjathjearim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David went up, and all Israel, to Baalah, that is, to Kirjathjearim, which belonged to Judah, to bring up from thence the ark of God the Lord, who dwelleth between the cherubims, whose name is called on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they carried the ark of God in a new cart out of the house of Abinadab; and Uzza and Ahio drove the cart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David and all Israel played before God with all their might, and with singing and with harps, and with psalteries and with timbrels, and with cymbals and with trumpets.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they came unto the threshing floor of Chidon, Uzza put forth his hand to hold the ark, for the oxen stumbled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the anger of the Lord was kindled against Uzza, and He smote him because he put his hand to the ark; and there he died before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David was displeased, because the Lord had broken forth upon Uzza. Therefore that place is called Perezuzza to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David was afraid of God that day, saying, “How shall I bring the ark of God home to me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So David brought not the ark home with him to the City of David, but carried it aside into the house of Obededom the Gittite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the ark of God remained with the family of Obededom in his house three months. And the Lord blessed the house of Obededom and all that he had.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and timber of cedars with masons and carpenters to build him a house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David perceived that the Lord had confirmed him king over Israel, for his kingdom was lifted up on high because of His people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David took more wives at Jerusalem; and David begot more sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the names of his children whom he had in Jerusalem: Shammua, and Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ibhar, and Elishua, and Elpelet,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Elishama, and Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Philistines heard that David was anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek David. And David heard of it and went out against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Philistines came and spread themselves in the Valley of Rephaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David inquired of God, saying, “Shall I go up against the Philistines? And wilt Thou deliver them into mine hand?” And the Lord said unto him, “Go up; for I will deliver them into thine hand.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they came up to Baalperazim, and David smote them there. Then David said, “God hath broken in upon mine enemies by mine hand like the breaking forth of waters.” Therefore they called the name of that place Baalperazim [that is, A place of breaches].
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had left their gods there, David gave a commandment, and they were burned with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Philistines yet again spread themselves abroad in the valley.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore David inquired again of God, and God said unto him, “Go not up after them; turn away from them and come upon them opposite the mulberry trees.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be, when thou shalt hear a sound of going in the tops of the mulberry trees, that then thou shalt go out to battle; for God has gone forth before thee to smite the host of the Philistines.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David therefore did as God commanded him; and they smote the host of the Philistines from Gibeon even to Gezer.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the fame of David went out into all lands, and the Lord brought the fear of him upon all nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David made himself houses in the City of David, and prepared a place for the ark of God and pitched for it a tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David said, “None ought to carry the ark of God but the Levites, for them hath the Lord chosen to carry the ark of God and to minister unto Him for ever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And David gathered all Israel together at Jerusalem to bring up the ark of the Lord unto his place, which he had prepared for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David assembled the children of Aaron and the Levites:
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Kohath, Uriel the chief, and his brethren a hundred and twenty;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Merari, Asaiah the chief, and his brethren two hundred and twenty;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Gershom, Joel the chief, and his brethren a hundred and thirty;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Elizaphan, Shemaiah the chief, and his brethren two hundred;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Hebron, Eliel the chief, and his brethren fourscore;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Uzziel, Amminadab the chief, and his brethren a hundred and twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites, for Uriel, Asaiah, and Joel, Shemaiah, and Eliel, and Amminadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said unto them, “Ye are the chiefs of the fathers of the Levites. Sanctify yourselves, both ye and your brethren, that ye may bring up the ark of the Lord God of Israel unto the place that I have prepared for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For because ye did it not at the first, the Lord our God broke forth upon us, for we sought Him not after the due order.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the priests and the Levites sanctified themselves to bring up the ark of the Lord God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of the Levites bore the ark of God upon their shoulders with the staves thereon, as Moses commanded according to the word of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David spoke to the chiefs of the Levites to appoint their brethren to be the singers with instruments of music: psalteries and harps and cymbals sounding, by lifting up the voice with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel; and of his brethren, Asaph the son of Berechiah; and of the sons of Merari their brethren, Ethan the son of Kushaiah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and with them their brethren of the second degree: Zechariah, Ben, and Jaaziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, Eliab, and Benaiah, and Maaseiah, and Mattithiah, and Elipheleh, and Mikneiah, and Obededom, and Jeiel, the doorkeepers.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan were appointed to sound with cymbals of brass;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Zechariah, and Aziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, and Eliab, and Maaseiah, and Benaiah, with psalteries on Alamoth;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Mattithiah, and Elipheleh, and Mikneiah, and Obededom, and Jeiel, and zaziah with harps on the Sheminith to lead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was for song; he instructed about the song, ecause he was skillful.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Berechiah and Elkanah were doorkeepers for the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Shebaniah, and Jehoshaphat, and Nethaneel, and Amasai, and Zechariah, nd Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, blew with the trumpets before the ark of God; and bededom and Jehiah were doorkeepers for the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David and the elders of Israel and the captains over thousands went to bring up the ark of the covenant of the Lord out of the house of Obededom with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, when God helped the Levites who bore the ark of the covenant of the Lord, that they offered seven bullocks and seven rams.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, and all the Levites who bore the ark, and the singers, and Chenaniah the master of the song with the singers; David also had upon him an ephod of linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the Lord with shouting and with sound of the cornet, and with trumpets and with cymbals, making a noise with psalteries and harps.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, as the ark of the covenant of the Lord came to the City of David, that Michal the daughter of Saul, looking out of a window, saw King David dancing and playing; and she despised him in her heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they brought the ark of God, and set it in the midst of the tent that David had pitched for it; and they offered burnt sacrifices and peace offerings before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when David had made an end of offering the burnt offerings and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he dealt to every one of Israel, both man and woman, to every one a loaf of bread, and a good piece of flesh, and a flagon of wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he appointed certain of the Levites to minister before the ark of the Lord, and to call to remembrance and to thank and praise the Lord God of Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text: Asaph the chief, and next to him Zechariah, Jeiel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Mattithiah, and Eliab, and Benaiah, and Obededom; and Jeiel with psalteries and with harps, but Asaph made a sound with cymbals;
speaker: Narrator

text: Benaiah also and Jahaziel the priests with trumpets continually before the ark of the covenant of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then on that day David delivered first this psalm, to thank the Lord, into the hand of Asaph and his brethren:
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks unto the Lord, call upon His name; make known His deeds among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto Him, sing psalms unto Him; talk ye of all His wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Glory ye in His holy name; let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seek the Lord and His strength; seek His face continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember His marvelous works that He hath done, His wonders and the judgments of His mouth,
speaker: Narrator

text: O ye seed of Israel His servant, ye children of Jacob, His chosen ones!
speaker: Narrator

text: He is the Lord our God; His judgments are in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be ye mindful always of His covenant, the word which He commanded to a thousand generations,
speaker: Narrator

text: even of the covenant which He made with Abraham, and of His oath unto Isaac;
speaker: Narrator

text: and hath confirmed the same to Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance,”
speaker: Narrator

text: when ye were but few, even a few, and strangers in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they went from nation to nation, and from one kingdom to another people,
speaker: Narrator

text: He suffered no man do them wrong; yea, He reproved kings for their sakes,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “Touch not Mine anointed, and do My prophets no harm.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto the Lord, all the earth; show forth from day to day His salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Declare His glory among the heathen, His marvelous works among all nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: For great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised; He also is to be feared above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the gods of the people are idols; but the Lord made the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Glory and honor are in His presence; strength and gladness are in His place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give unto the Lord, ye kindreds of the people, give unto the Lord glory and strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give unto the Lord the glory due unto His name; bring an offering, and come before Him; worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear before Him, all the earth! The world also shall be stable, that it be not moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice; and let men say among the nations, “The Lord reigneth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the sea roar, and the fullness thereof; let the fields rejoice, and all that is therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall the trees of the wood sing out at the presence of the Lord, because He cometh to judge the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: O give thanks unto the Lord, for He is good; for His mercy endureth for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And say ye, “Save us, O God of our salvation, and gather us together, and deliver us from the heathen, that we may give thanks to Thy holy name, and glory in Thy praise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel for ever and ever! And all the people said, “Amen,” and praised the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he left there Asaph and his brethren before the ark of the covenant of the Lord to minister before the ark continually, as every day’s workrequired;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Obededom with their brethren, threescore and eight; Obededom also the son of Jeduthun and Hosah, to be doorkeepers;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Zadok the priest and his brethren the priests, before the tabernacle of the Lord in the high place that was at Gibeon,
speaker: Narrator

text: to offer burnt offerings unto the Lord upon the altar of the burnt offering continually morning and evening, and to do according to all that is written in the Law of the Lord, which He commanded Israel;
speaker: Narrator

text: and with them Heman and Jeduthun and the rest who were chosen, who were expressed by name, to give thanks to the Lord because His mercy endureth for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: and with them Heman and Jeduthun with trumpets and cymbals for those who should make a sound, and with musical instruments of God. And the sons of Jeduthun were for the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people departed, every man to his house; and David returned to bless his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it came to pass as David sat in his house, that David said to Nathan the prophet, “Lo, I dwell in a house of cedars, but the ark of the covenant of the Lord remaineth under curtains.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Nathan said unto David, “Do all that is in thine heart, for God is with thee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass the same night that the word of God came to Nathan, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go and tell David My servant, ‘Thus saith the Lord: Thou shalt not build Me a house to dwell in;
speaker: Narrator
