text: for I have not dwelt in a house since the day that I brought up Israel unto this day, but have gone from tent to tent, and from one tabernacle to another.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wheresoever I have walked with all Israel, spoke I a word to any of the judges of Israel whom I commanded to feed My people, saying, “Why have ye not built Me a house of cedars?”’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore thus shalt thou say unto My servant David, ‘Thus saith the Lord of hosts: I took thee from the sheepcote, even from following the sheep, that thou shouldest be ruler over My people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have been with thee whithersoever thou hast walked, and have cut off all thine enemies from before thee, and have made thee a name like the name of the great men who are on the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also I will ordain a place for My people Israel, and will plant them, and they shall dwell in their place and shall be moved no more; neither shall the children of wickedness waste them any more, as at the beginning
speaker: Narrator

text: and since the time that I commanded judges to be over My people Israel. Moreover I will subdue all thine enemies. Furthermore I tell thee that the Lord will build thee a house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, when thy days be expired that thou must go to be with thy fathers, that I will raise up thy seed after thee, who shall be of thy sons; and I will establish his kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall build Me a house, and I will establish his throne for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be his Father, and he shall be My son; and I will not take My mercy away from him, as I took it from him that was before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will settle him in Mine house and in My kingdom for ever; and his throne shall be established for evermore.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: According to all these words and according to all this vision, so did Nathan speak unto David.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David the king came and sat before the Lord and said, “Who am I, O Lord God, and what is mine house, that Thou hast brought me hitherto?
speaker: Narrator

text: And yet this was a small thing in Thine eyes, O God; for Thou hast also spoken of Thy servant’s house for a great while to come, and hast regarded me according to the estate of a man of high degree, O Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: What can David speak more to Thee for the honor of Thy servant? For Thou knowest Thy servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, for Thy servant’s sake and according to Thine own heart hast Thou done all this greatness, in making known all these great things.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, there is none like Thee, neither is there any God besides Thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
speaker: Narrator

text: And what one nation on the earth is like Thy people Israel, whom God went to redeem to be His own people, to make Thee a name of greatness and fearsomeness by driving out nations from before Thy people, whom Thou hast redeemed out of Egypt?
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thy people Israel didst Thou make Thine own people for ever; and Thou, Lord, becamest their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore now, Lord, let the thing that Thou hast spoken concerning Thy servant and concerning his house be established for ever, and do as Thou hast said.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let it even be established, that Thy name may be magnified for ever, saying, ‘The Lord of hosts is the God of Israel, even a God to Israel; and let the house of David Thy servant be established before Thee.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou, O my God, hast told Thy servant that Thou wilt build him a house; therefore Thy servant hath found in his heart to pray before Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, Lord, Thou art God, and hast promised this goodness unto Thy servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore let it please Thee to bless the house of Thy servant, that it may be before Thee for ever; for Thou blessest, O Lord, and it shall be blessed for ever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now after this it came to pass that David smote the Philistines and subdued them, and took Gath and her towns out of the hand of the Philistines.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he smote Moab, and the Moabites became David’s servants and brought gifts.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David smote Hadarezer king of Zobah toward Hamath, as he went to establish his dominion by the River Euphrates.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David took from him a thousand chariots, and seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen. David also hamstrung all the chariot horses, but reserved enough of them for a hundred chariots.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah, David slew of the Syrians two and twenty thousand men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David put garrisons in Syriadamascus; and the Syrians became David’s servants, and brought gifts. Thus the Lord preserved David whithersoever he went.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadadezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise from Tibhath and from Chun, cities of Hadadezer, David brought very much brass, wherewith Solomon made the brazen sea and the pillars and the vessels of brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Tou king of Hamath heard how David had smitten all the host of Hadadezer king of Zobah,
speaker: Narrator

text: he sent Hadoram his son to King David to inquire of his welfare and to congratulate him, because he had fought against Hadadezer and smitten him (for Hadadezer had wars with Tou); and he sent with him all manner of vessels of gold and silver and brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: These also King David dedicated unto the Lord, with the silver and the gold that he brought from all these nations — from Edom, and from Moab, and from the children of Ammon, and from the Philistines, and from Amalek.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover Abishai the son of Zeruiah slew eighteen thousand of the Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites became David’s servants. Thus the Lord preserved David whithersoever he went.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David reigned over all Israel, and executed judgment and justice among all his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the army, and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud, recorder.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Zadok the son of Ahitub and Abimelech the son of Abiathar were the priests; and Shavsha was scribe;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and the sons of David were chief about the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it came to pass after this, that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon died, and his son reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said, “I will show kindness unto Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.” And David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. So the servants of David came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun to comfort him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the princes of the children of Ammon said to Hanun, “Thinkest thou that David doth honor thy father, that he hath sent comforters unto thee? Are not his servants come unto thee to search and to overthrow and to spy out the land?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Hanun took David’s servants and shaved them, and cut off their garments in the middle by their buttocks, and sent them away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then went certain ones and told David how the men were served. And he sent to meet them, for the men were greatly ashamed. And the king said, “Tarry at Jericho until your beards have grown, and then return.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the children of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire for themselves chariots and horsemen from Mesopotamia and from Syriamaachah and from Zobah.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they hired thirty and two thousand chariots, and the king of Maachah and his people, who came and pitched camp before Medeba. And the children of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities and came to battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when David heard of it, he sent Joab and all the host of the mighty men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Ammon came out and assembled in battle array before the gate of the city, and the kings who had come were by themselves in the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Joab saw that the battle line was formed against him before and behind, he chose out of all the choice men of Israel, and put them in array against the Syrians.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the rest of the people he delivered unto the hand of Abishai his brother, and they set themselves in array against the children of Ammon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “If the Syrians are too strong for me, then thou shalt help me; but if the children of Ammon are too strong for thee, then I will help thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be of good courage, and let us behave ourselves valiantly for our people and for the cities of our God; and let the Lord do that which is good in His sight.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joab and the people who were with him drew nigh before the Syrians unto the battle, and they fled before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the children of Ammon saw that the Syrians had fled, they likewise fled before Abishai his brother, and entered into the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Syrians saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they sent messengers and drew forth the Syrians who were beyond the river; and Shophach the captain of the host of Hadadezer went before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was told to David; and he gathered all Israel, and passed over the Jordan and came upon them, and set the battle in array against them. So when David had put the battle in array against the Syrians, they fought with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Syrians fled before Israel; and David slew of the Syrians seven thousand men who fought in chariots and forty thousand footmen, and killed Shophach the captain of the host.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the servants of Hadadezer saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they made peace with David and became his servants; neither would the Syrians help the children of Ammon any more.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass after the year had expired, at the time that kings go out to battle, that Joab led forth the power of the army and laid waste the country of the children of Ammon, and came and besieged Rabbah. But David tarried at Jerusalem. And Joab smote Rabbah and destroyed it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David took the crown of their king from off his head, and found it to weigh a talent of gold, and there were precious stones in it; and it was set upon David’s head. And he brought also exceeding much spoil out of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he brought out the people who were in it, and cut them with saws and with harrows of iron and with axes. Even so dealt David with all the cities of the children of Ammon. And David and all the people returned to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass after this that there arose war at Gezer with the Philistines, at which time Sibbechai the Hushathite slew Sippai, who was one of the children of the giant; and they were subdued.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was war again with the Philistines; and Elhanan the son of Jair slew Lahmi, the brother of Goliath the Gittite, whose spear staff was like a weaver’s beam.
speaker: Narrator

text: And yet again there was war at Gath, where was a man of great stature, whose fingers and toes were four and twenty, six on each hand and six on each foot; and he also was the son of the giant.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea, David’s brother, slew him.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were born unto the giant in Gath, and they fell by the hand of David and by the hand of his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Satan stood up against Israel, and provoked David to number Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said to Joab and to the rulers of the people, “Go, number Israel from Beersheba even to Dan, and bring the number of them to me, that I may know it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joab answered, “The Lord make His people a hundred times more than they are. But, my lord the king, are they not all my lord’s servants? Why then doth my lord require this thing? Why will he be a cause of trespass to Israel?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless the king’s word prevailed against Joab. Therefore Joab departed, and went throughout all Israel and came to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joab gave the sum of the number of the people unto David. And all they of Israel were a thousand thousand and a hundred thousand men who drew the sword, and Judah was four hundred threescore and ten thousand men who drew the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Levi and Benjamin he counted not among them, for the king’s word was abominable to Joab.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God was displeased with this thing; therefore He smote Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said unto God, “I have sinned greatly because I have done this thing. But now, I beseech Thee, do away with the iniquity of Thy servant, for I have done very foolishly.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke unto Gad, David’s seer, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go and tell David, saying, ‘Thus saith the Lord: I offer thee three things. Choose thee one of them, that I may do it unto thee.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Gad came to David, and said unto him, “Thus saith the Lord: ‘Choose thee
speaker: Narrator

text: either three years’ famine; or three months to be destroyed before thy foes while the sword of thine enemies overtaketh thee; or else three days the sword of the Lord, even the pestilence in the land and the angel of the Lord destroying throughout all the coasts of Israel.’ Now therefore advise thyself what word I shall bring back to Him that sent me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord sent pestilence upon Israel, and there fell of Israel seventy thousand men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God sent an angel unto Jerusalem to destroy it; and as he was destroying, the Lord beheld, and He repented of the evil, and said to the angel who destroyed, “It is enough. Stay now thine hand.” And the angel of the Lord stood by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David lifted up his eyes and saw the angel of the Lord standing between the earth and the heaven, having a drawn sword in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders of Israel, who were clothed in sackcloth, fell upon their faces.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said unto God, “Is it not I that commanded the people to be numbered? Even I it is who have sinned and done evil indeed; but as for these sheep, what have they done? Let Thine hand, I pray Thee, O Lord my God, be on me and on my father’s house, but not on Thy people, that they should be plagued.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the angel of the Lord commanded Gad to say to David that David should go up and set up an altar unto the Lord on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David went up at the saying of Gad, which he spoke in the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ornan turned back and saw the angel, and his four sons with him hid themselves. Now Ornan was threshing wheat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David, and went out from the threshing floor and bowed himself to David with his face to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David said to Ornan, “Grant me the place of this threshing floor, that I may uild an altar therein unto the Lord. Thou shalt grant it to me for the full price, that the plague ay be stayed from the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ornan said unto David, “Take it to thee, and let my lord the king do that hich is good in his eyes. Lo, I give thee the oxen also for burnt offerings, and the threshing nstruments for wood, and the wheat for the meat offering; I give it all.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And King David said to Ornan, “Nay, but I will verily buy it for the full price; for will not take that which is thine for the Lord, nor offer burnt offerings without cost.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So David gave to Ornan for the place six hundred shekels of gold by weight.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David built there an altar unto the Lord, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings, and called upon the Lord; and He answered him from heaven by fire upon the altar of burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord commanded the angel, and he put up his sword again into the sheath thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time when David saw that the Lord had answered him on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, then he sacrificed there.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the tabernacle of the Lord, which Moses made in the wilderness, and the altar of the burnt offering were at that season at the high place at Gibeon.
speaker: Narrator

text: But David could not go before it to inquire of God, for he was afraid because of the sword of the angel of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David said, “This is the house of the Lord God, and this is the altar of the burnt offering for Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And David commanded to gather together the strangers who were in the land of Israel, and he set masons to hew wrought stones to build the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David prepared iron in abundance for the nails for the doors of the gates and for the joinings, and brass in abundance beyond measure,
speaker: Narrator

text: also cedar trees in abundance; for the Sidonians and those of Tyre brought much cedar wood to David.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said, “Solomon my son is young and tender, and the house that is to be built for the Lord must be exceedingly magnificent, of fame and of glory throughout all countries. I will therefore now make preparation for it.” So David prepared abundantly before his death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he called for Solomon his son, and charged him to build a house for the Lord God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said to Solomon, “My son, as for me, it was in my mind to build a house unto the name of the Lord my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the word of the Lord came to me, saying, ‘Thou hast shed blood abundantly, and hast made great wars. Thou shalt not build a house unto My name, because thou hast shed much blood upon the earth in My sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, a son shall be born to thee, who shall be a man of rest. And I will give him rest from all his enemies round about; for his name shall be Solomon [that is, Peaceable], and I will give peace and quietness unto Israel in his days.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall build a house for My name, and he shall be My son, and I will be his Father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel for ever.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, my son, the Lord be with thee; and prosper thou, and build the house of the Lord thy God, as He hath said of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the Lord give thee wisdom and understanding, and give thee charge concerning Israel, that thou mayest keep the law of the Lord thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou prosper, if thou takest heed to fulfill the statutes and judgments which the Lord charged Moses with concerning Israel. Be strong and of good courage; dread not, nor be dismayed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now behold, in my trouble I have prepared for the house of the Lord a hundred thousand talents of gold, and a thousand thousand talents of silver, and of brass and iron beyond measure, for it is in abundance. Timber also and stone have I prepared, and thou mayest add thereto.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover there are workmen with thee in abundance: hewers and workers of stone and timber, and all manner of skillful men for every manner of work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the gold, the silver and the brass and the iron, there is no number. Arise therefore and be doing, and the Lord be with thee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David also commanded all the princes of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Is not the Lord your God with you? And hath He not given you rest on every side? For He hath given the inhabitants of the land into mine hand, and the land is subdued before the Lord and before His people.]
speaker: Narrator

text: Now set your heart and your soul to seek the Lord your God. Arise therefore, and build ye the sanctuary of the Lord God, to bring the ark of the covenant of the Lord and the holy vessels of God into the house that is to be built to the name of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So when David was old and full of days, he made Solomon his son king over Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he gathered together all the princes of Israel, with the priests and the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Levites were numbered from the age of thirty years and upward; and their number by their head count, man by man, was thirty and eight thousand,
speaker: Narrator

text: of whom twenty and four thousand were to oversee the work of the house of the Lord, and six thousand were officers and judges.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover four thousand were doorkeepers, and four thousand praised the Lord with the instruments “which I made,” said David, “to praise therewith.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And David divided them into divisions among the sons of Levi, namely, Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Gershonites were Laadan and Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Laadan: the chief was Jehiel, and Zetham, and Joel, three.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shimei: Shelomith, and Haziel, and Haran, three. These were the chief of the fathers of Laadan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Shimei were Jahath, Zina, and Jeush, and Beriah. These four were the sons of Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jahath was the chief, and Zizah the second; but Jeush and Beriah had not many sons; therefore they were in one reckoning, according to their father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses; and Aaron was separated, that he should sanctify the most holy things, he and his sons for ever, to burn incense before the Lord, to minister unto Him, and to bless in His name for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now concerning Moses the man of God, his sons were named of the tribe of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Moses were Gershom and Eliezer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Gershom, Shebuel was the chief.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the son of Eliezer was Rehabiah, the chief. And Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Izhar, Shelomith was the chief.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Hebron: Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Uzziel: Micah the first, and Jesiah the second.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Eleazar died and had no sons, but daughters; and their brethren the sons of Kish took them as wives.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, and Eder, and Jeremoth, three.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Levi according to the house of their fathers, even the chief of the fathers, as they were counted by number of names by their heads, who did the work for the service of the house of the Lord, from the age of twenty years and upward.
speaker: Narrator

text: For David said, “The Lord God of Israel hath given rest unto His people, that they may dwell in Jerusalem for ever”;
speaker: Narrator

text: and also unto the Levites, “They shall no more carry the tabernacle, nor any vessels of it for the service thereof.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For by the last words of David the Levites were numbered from twenty years old and above,
speaker: Narrator

text: because their office was to wait on the sons of Aaron for the service of the house of the Lord in the courts and in the chambers, and in the purifying of all holy things, and the work of the service of the house of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: both for the showbread and for the fine flour for meat offering, and for the unleavened cakes and for that which is baked in the pan and for that which is fried, and for all manner of measure and size;
speaker: Narrator

text: and to stand every morning to thank and praise the Lord, and likewise at evening;
speaker: Narrator

text: and to offer all burnt sacrifices unto the Lord on the Sabbaths, on the new moons, and on the set feasts, by number according to the order commanded unto them, continually before the Lord;
speaker: Narrator

text: and that they should keep the charge of the tabernacle of the congregation, and the charge of the holy place, and the charge of the sons of Aaron their brethren in the service of the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the divisions of the sons of Aaron. The sons of Aaron: Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father and had no children; therefore Eleazar and Ithamar executed the priest’s office.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David assigned them, both Zadok of the sons of Eleazar and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, according to their offices in their service.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there were more chief men found of the sons of Eleazar than of the sons of Ithamar, and thus were they divided. Among the sons of Eleazar there were sixteen chief men of the house of their fathers, and eight among the sons of Ithamar according to the house of their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus were they divided by lot, one sort with another, for the governors of the sanctuary and governors of the house of God were of the sons of Eleazar and of the sons of Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Shemaiah the son of Nethaneel the scribe, one of the Levites, wrote them in the presence of the king and the princes, and Zadok the priest, and Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, and before the chief of the fathers of the priests and Levites: one principal household being taken for Eleazar and one taken for Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the first lot came forth to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,
speaker: Narrator

text: the fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin,
speaker: Narrator

text: the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,
speaker: Narrator

text: the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
speaker: Narrator

text: the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,
speaker: Narrator

text: the seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Happizzez,
speaker: Narrator

text: the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezekel,
speaker: Narrator

text: the one and twentieth to Jachin, the two and twentieth to Gamul,
speaker: Narrator

text: the three and twentieth to Delaiah, the four and twentieth to Maaziah.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the orderings of them in their service to come into the house of the Lord, according to their manner under Aaron their father, as the Lord God of Israel had commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the rest of the sons of Levi were these: of the sons of Amram, Shubael; of the sons of Shubael, Jehdeiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Concerning Rehabiah, of the sons of Rehabiah, the first was Isshiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Izharites, Shelomoth; of the sons of Shelomoth, Jahath.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Hebron, Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, Jekameam the fourth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Uzziel, Michah; of the sons of Michah, Shamir.
speaker: Narrator

text: The brother of Michah was Isshiah; of the sons of Isshiah, Zechariah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi: the son of Jaaziah, Beno.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari by Jaaziah: Beno, and Shoham, and Zaccur, and Ibri.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Mahli came Eleazar, who had no sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Concerning Kish: the son of Kish was Jerahmeel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons also of Mushi; Mahli, and Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites after the house of their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: These likewise cast lots even as their brethren the sons of Aaron, in the presence of David the king, and Zadok, and Ahimelech, and the chief of the fathers of the priests and Levites; even the principal fathers did as their younger brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover David and the captains of the host separated for the service the sons of Asaph, and of Heman, and of Jeduthun, who should prophesy with harps, with psalteries, and with cymbals; and the number of the workmen according to their service was:
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, and Joseph, and Nethaniah, and Asarelah; the sons of Asaph were under the hand of Asaph, who prophesied according to the order of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Jeduthun, the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, and Zeri, and Jeshaiah, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah [with Shimei, mentioned], six, under the hand of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied with a harp to give thanks and to praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Heman, the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, and Romamtiezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were the sons of Heman the king’s seer in the matters of God, to lift up the horn. And God gave to Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were under the hand of their father for song in the house of the Lord with cymbals, psalteries and harps, for the service of the house of God, according to the king’s order to Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the number of them, with their brethren who were instructed in the songs of the Lord, even all who were skilled, was two hundred fourscore and eight.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they cast lots, watch against watch, the small as well as the great, the teacher as the scholar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the first lot came forth for Asaph to Joseph; the second to Gedaliah, who with his brethren and sons were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the third to Zaccur: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the fourth to Izri: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the fifth to Nethaniah: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the sixth to Bukkiah: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the seventh to Jesharelah: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the eighth to Jeshaiah: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the ninth to Mattaniah: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the tenth to Shimei: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the eleventh to Azarel: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the twelfth to Hashabiah: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the thirteenth to Shubael: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the fourteenth to Mattithiah: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the fifteenth to Jeremoth: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the sixteenth to Hananiah: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the seventeenth to Joshbekashah: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the eighteenth to Hanani: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the nineteenth to Mallothi: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the twentieth to Eliathah: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the one and twentieth to Hothir: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the two and twentieth to Giddalti: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the three and twentieth to Mahazioth: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the four and twentieth to Romamtiezer: he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: Concerning the divisions of the doorkeepers: of theKorahites was Meshelemiah the son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Meshelemiah were Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, Elioenai the seventh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the sons of Obededom were Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, and Sacar the fourth, and Nethanel the fifth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peulthai the eighth; for God blessed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also unto Shemaiah his son were sons born who ruled throughout the house of their father; for they were mighty men of valor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shemaiah: Othni, and Rephael, and Obed, and Elzabad, whose brethren were strong men, Elihu, and Semachiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were of the sons of Obededom; they and their sons and their brethren, able men with strength for the service were threescore and two of Obededom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Meshelemiah had sons and brethren, strong men, eighteen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Hosah, of the children of Merari, had sons: Shimri the chief (for though he was not the firstborn, yet his father made him the chief),
speaker: Narrator

text: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth; all the sons and brethren of Hosah were thirteen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Among these were the divisions of the doorkeepers, even among the chief men, having watches, one as another, to minister in the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they cast lots for every gate, the small as well as the great, according to the house of their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the lot eastward fell to Shelemiah [called Meshelemiah]. Then for Zechariah his son, a wise counselor, they cast lots; and his lot came out northward.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Obededom southward, and to his sons the house of gatherings.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Shuppim and Hosah the lot came forth westward, with the gate of Shallecheth by the ascending causeway, watch opposite watch.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eastward were six Levites, northward four a day, southward four a day, and toward the house of gatherings, two and two.
speaker: Narrator

text: At Parbar westward, four at the causeway and two at Parbar.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the divisions of the doorkeepers among the sons of Korah and among the sons of Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the Levites, Ahijah was over the treasuries of the house of God and over the treasuries of the dedicated things.
speaker: Narrator

text: As concerning the sons of Laadan, the sons of the Gershonites of Laadan, chief fathers, even of Laadan the Gershonite, were Jehieli.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jehieli: Zetham and Joel his brother, who were over the treasuries of the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Amramites, and the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Uzzielites:
speaker: Narrator

text: Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was ruler of the treasuries.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his brethren by Eliezer: Rehabiah his son, and Jeshaiah his son, and Joram his son, and Zichri his son, and Shelomith his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: This Shelomith and his brethren were over all the treasuries of the dedicated things which David the king and the chief fathers, the captains over thousands and hundreds, and the captains of the host, had dedicated.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the spoils won in battles did they dedicate to maintain the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all that Samuel the seer, and Saul the son of Kish, and Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah had dedicated, and whosoever had dedicated any thing, it was under the hand of Shelomith and his brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were for the outside business over Israel, as officers and judges.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brethren, men of valor, a thousand and seven hundred, were officers among those of Israel on this side of the Jordan westward, in all the business of the Lord and in the service of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Among the Hebronites Jerijah was the chief, even among the Hebronites, according to the generations of his fathers. In the fortieth year of the reign of David they were sought for, and there were found among them mighty men of valor at Jazer of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his brethren, men of valor, were two thousand and seven hundred chief fathers, whom King David made rulers over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the halftribe of Manasseh, for every matter pertaining to God and affairs of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the children of Israel according to their number, to wit, the chief fathers and captains of thousands and hundreds, and their officers who served the king in any matter of the succession of duties, who came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year, of every course were twenty and four thousand:
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the first course for the first month was Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel, and in his course were twenty and four thousand;
speaker: Narrator

text: he was of the children of Perez and the chief of all the captains of the host for the first month.
speaker: Narrator

text: And over the course of the second month was Dodai an Ahohite, and of his course was Mikloth also the ruler; in his course likewise were twenty and four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The third captain of the host for the third month was Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, a chief priest; and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is that Benaiah, who was mighty among the thirty, and above the thirty; and in his course was Ammizabad his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fourth captain for the fourth month was Asahel the brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him; and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fifth captain for the fifth month was Shamhuth the Izrahite; and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sixth captain for the sixth month was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite; and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seventh captain for the seventh month was Helez the Pelonite, of the children of Ephraim; and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eighth captain for the eighth month was Sibbecai the Hushathite, of the Zarhites; and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ninth captain for the ninth month was Abiezer the Anathothite, of the Benjamites; and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tenth captain for the tenth month was Maharai the Netophathite, of the Zarhites; and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eleventh captain for the eleventh month was Benaiah the Pirathonite, of the children of Ephraim; and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The twelfth captain for the twelfth month was Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel; and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore over the tribes of Israel: the ruler of the Reubenites was Eliezer the son of Zichri; of the Simeonites, Shephatiah the son of Maachah;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the Levites, Hashabiah the son of Kemuel; of the Aaronites, Zadok;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Judah, Elihu, one of the brethren of David; of Issachar, Omri the son of Michael;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Zebulun, Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah; of Naphtali, Jerimoth the son of Azriel;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the children of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Azaziah; of the halftribe of Manasseh, Joel the son of Pedaiah;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the halftribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah; of Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Dan, Azarel the son of Jeroham. These were the princes of the tribes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But David took not the number of them from twenty years old and under, because the Lord had said He would increase Israel like the stars of the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joab the son of Zeruiah began to number them but he finished not, because there fell wrath because of it against Israel, neither was the number put in the account of the chronicles of King David.
speaker: Narrator

text: And over the king’s treasuries was Azmaveth the son of Adiel; and over the storehouses in the fields, in the cities, and in the villages, and in the strongholds, was Jehonathan the son of Uzziah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And over those who did the work of the field for tillage of the ground was Ezri the son of Chelub.
speaker: Narrator

text: And over the vineyards was Shimei the Ramathite; over the increase of the vineyards for the wine cellars was Zabdi the Shiphmite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And over the olive trees and the sycamore trees that were in the low plains was Baalhanan the Gederite, and over the cellars of oil was Joash.
speaker: Narrator

text: And over the herds that fed in Sharon was Shitrai the Sharonite, and over the herds that were in the valleys was Shaphat the son of Adlai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the camels also was Obil the Ishmaelite, and over the asses was Jehdeiah the Meronothite,
speaker: Narrator

text: and over the flocks was Jaziz the Hagerite. All these were the rulers of the substance which was King David’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Jonathan, David’s uncle, was a counselor, a wise man, and a scribe; and Jehiel the son of Hachmoni was with the king’s sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ahithophel was the king’s counselor, and Hushai the Archite was the king’s companion.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after Ahithophel was Jehoiada the son of Benaiah, and Abiathar. And the general of the king’s army was Joab.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David assembled unto Jerusalem all the princes of Israel, the princes of the tribes, and the captains of the companies who ministered to the king by course, and the captains over the thousands, and captains over the hundreds, and the stewards over all the substance and possessions of the king and of his sons, with the officers, and with the mighty men, and with all the valiant men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David the king stood up upon his feet and said, “Hear me, my brethren and my people: As for me, I had in mine heart to build a house of rest for the ark of the covenant of the Lord, and for the footstool of our God, and had made ready for the building.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God said unto me, ‘Thou shalt not build a house for My name, because thou hast been a man of war and hast shed blood.’
speaker: Narrator

text: However that be, the Lord God of Israel chose me before all the house of my father to be king over Israel for ever; for He hath chosen Judah to be the ruler; and of the house of Judah, the house of my father, and among the sons of my father He favored me to make me king over all Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of all my sons (for the Lord hath given me many sons), He hath chosen Solomon my son to sit upon the throne of the kingdom of the Lord over Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto me, ‘Solomon thy son, he shall build My house and My courts; for I have chosen him to be My son, and I will be his Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover I will establish his kingdom for ever, if he be constant to do My commandments and My judgments, as at this day.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore in the sight of all Israel, the congregation of the Lord, and in the audience of our God, keep and seek for all the commandments of the Lord your God, that ye may possess this good land, and leave it for an inheritance for your children after you for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And thou, Solomon my son, know thou the God of thy father, and serve Him with a perfect heart and with a willing mind; for the Lord searcheth all hearts and understandeth all the imaginations of the thoughts. If thou seek Him, He will be found by thee; but if thou forsake Him, He will cast thee off for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take heed now, for the Lord hath chosen thee to build a house for the sanctuary. Be strong, and do it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David gave to Solomon his son the pattern of the porch, and of the houses thereof, and of the treasuries thereof, and of the upper chambers thereof, and of the inner parlors thereof, and of the place of the mercy seat;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the pattern of all that he had by the Spirit, of the courts of the house of the Lord and of all the chambers round about, of the treasuries of the house of God and of the treasuries of the dedicated things;
speaker: Narrator

text: also for the courses of the priests and the Levites, and for all the work of the service of the house of the Lord, and for all the vessels of service in the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave gold by weight for things of gold, for all instruments of all manner of service; silver also for all instruments of silver by weight, for all instruments of every kind of service;
speaker: Narrator

text: even the weight for the candlesticks of gold and for their lamps of gold, by weight for every candlestick and for the lamps thereof; and for the candlesticks of silver by weight, both for the candlestick and also for the lamps thereof, according to the use of every candlestick.
speaker: Narrator

text: And by weight he gave gold for the tables of showbread, for every table, and likewise silver for the tables of silver;
speaker: Narrator

text: also pure gold for the fleshhooks and the bowls and the cups; and for the golden basins he gave gold by weight for every basin, and likewise silver by weight for every basin of silver;
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the altar of incense refined gold by weight, and gold for the pattern of the chariot of the cherubims that spread out their wings and covered the ark of the covenant of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “All this,” said David, “the Lord made me understand in writing by His hand upon me, even all the works of this pattern.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said to Solomon his son, “Be strong and of good courage, and do it. Fear not, nor be dismayed, for the Lord God, even my God, will be with thee. He will not fail thee, nor forsake thee, until thou hast finished all the work for the service of the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, the courses of the priests and the Levites, even they shall be with thee for all the service of the house of God; and there shall be with thee for all manner of workmanship every willing skillful man, for any manner of service. Also the princes and all the people will be wholly at thy command.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore David the king said unto all the congregation, “Solomon my son, whom alone God hath chosen, is yet young and tender, and the work is great; for the palace is not for man, but for the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I have prepared with all my might for the house of my God the gold for things to be made of gold, and the silver for things of silver, and the brass for things of brass, the iron for things of iron, and wood for things of wood, onyx stones, and stones to be set, glistening stones of divers colors, and all manner of precious stones, and marble stones in abundance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, because I have set my affection on the house of my God, I have of mine own private goods, of gold and silver, which I have given to the house of my God, over and above all that I have prepared for the holy house:
speaker: Narrator

text: even three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver with which to overlay the walls of the houses,
speaker: Narrator

text: the gold for things of gold and the silver for things of silver, and for all manner of work to be made by the hands of artificers. And who then is willing to consecrate his service this day unto the Lord?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the chiefs of the fathers and princes of the tribes of Israel, and the captains of thousands and of hundreds, with the rulers of the king’s work, offered willingly,
speaker: Narrator

text: and gave for the service of the house of God of gold five thousand talents and ten thousand drams, and of silver ten thousand talents, and of brass eighteen thousand talents, and one hundred thousand talents of iron.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those with whom precious stones were found gave them to the treasury of the house of the Lord, by the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the people rejoiced, for they had offered willingly, because with perfect heart they offered willingly to the Lord; and David the king also rejoiced with great joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore David blessed the Lord before all the congregation. And David said: “Blessed be Thou, Lord God of Israel, our Father, for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine, O Lord, is the greatness, and the power and the glory, and the victory and the majesty; for all that is in the heaven and in the earth is Thine. Thine is the kingdom, O Lord, and Thou art exalted as head above all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Both riches and honor come from Thee, and Thou reignest over all. And in Thine hand is power and might; and in Thine hand it is to make great, and to give strength unto all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, our God, we thank Thee and praise Thy glorious name.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But who am I, and what is my people, that we should be able to offer so willingly in this manner? For all things come from Thee, and from Thine own have we given Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are strangers before Thee, and sojourners, as were all our fathers; our days on the earth are as a shadow, and there is none abiding.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord our God, all this store that we have prepared to build Thee a house for Thine holy name cometh from Thine hand and is all Thine own.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know also, my God, that Thou triest the heart, and hast pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of mine heart I have willingly offered all these things; and now have I seen with joy Thy people, who are present here to offer willingly unto Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord God of Abraham, Isaac, and of Israel, our fathers, keep this for ever in the imagination of the thoughts of the heart of Thy people, and prepare their heart unto Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And give unto Solomon my son a perfect heart to keep Thy commandments, Thy testimonies, and Thy statutes, and to do all these things, and to build the palace, for which I have made provision.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said to all the congregation, “Now bless the Lord your God.” And all the congregation blessed the Lord God of their fathers, and bowed down their heads and worshiped the Lord and the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they sacrificed sacrifices unto the Lord, and offered burnt offerings unto the Lord on the morrow after that day: even a thousand bullocks, a thousand rams, and a thousand lambs, with their drink offerings, and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they ate and drank before the Lord on that day with great gladness. And they made Solomon, the son of David, king the second time, and anointed him unto the Lord to be the chief governor, and Zadok to be priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon sat on the throne of the Lord as king instead of David his father, and prospered; and all Israel obeyed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the princes and the mighty men, and all the sons likewise of King David, submitted themselves unto Solomon the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord magnified Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel, and bestowed upon him such royal majesty as had not been on any king before him in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the time that he reigned over Israel was forty years: seven years reigned he in Hebron, and thirty and three years reigned he in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and honor; and Solomon his son reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the acts of David the king, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of Samuel the seer, and in the book of Nathan the prophet, and in the book of Gad the seer,
speaker: Narrator

text: with all his reign and his might, and the times that went over him, and over Israel, and over all the kingdoms of the countries.
speaker: Narrator
